HomePage.title: The First Dominican Republic University Division Winners at NASA's Human Exploration Rover Challenge
HomePage.stemVisitSubtitle: Complete the form for your Educational Center
HomePage.sponsorUsSubtitle: The team needs your help to win!

overallWinner1.title: Overall Winner #1
overallWinner1.description: Awarded to the top overall team. Design reviews, educational STEM engagement, safety, and a successful excursion will all factor into the Overall Winner.

overallWinner2.title: Overall Winner #2
overallWinner2.description: Awarded to the top overall team. Design reviews, educational STEM engagement, safety, and a successful excursion will all factor into the Overall Winner.

overallWinner3.title: Overall Winner #3
overallWinner3.description: Awarded to the top overall team. Design reviews, educational STEM engagement, safety, and a successful excursion will all factor into the Overall Winner.

stemEngagement.title: STEM Engagement Award
stemEngagement.description: Awarded to the team that is determined to have best inspired the study of STEM-related topics in their community to include collaboration with middle school students for the Task Challenge. This team not only presented a high number of activities to a large number of people, but also delivered quality activities to a wide range of audiences.

projectReview.title: Project Review
projectReview.description: Awarded to the team that is deemed to have the best combination of written reviews and formal presentations.

phoenix.title: Phoenix
phoenix.description: Awarded to the team that demonstrates the greatest improvement between Design Review and Operational Readiness Review.

socialMedia.title: Social Media
socialMedia.description: Awarded to the team that has the most active and creative social media presence throughout the project year.

taskChallenge.title: Task Challenge
taskChallenge.description: Awarded to the team that best demonstrates a multi-tool design for the liquid sample retrieval tasks.

featherweight.title: Featherweight
featherweight.description: Awarded to the team that best addressed the ongoing space exploration challenge of weight management, delivering an innovative approach to safe minimization of rover weight. (Only awarded to one team overall.)

ingenuity.title: Ingenuity
ingenuity.description: Awarded to the team that approaches any complex project or engineering problem in unique and creative ways.

pitCrew.title: Pit Crew
pitCrew.description: Awarded to the team as judged by the pit crew that best demonstrates resourcefulness, motivation, good sportsmanship, and team spirit in repairing or working on their rover while the teams are in the pit area.

systemSafety.title: System Safety Award
systemSafety.description: Awarded to the team that best demonstrates a comprehensive approach to system safety as it relates to their vehicle, personnel, and operations.

teamSpirit.title: Team Spirit Award
teamSpirit.description: Awarded to the team that is judged by their peers that display the 'Best Team Spirit' during the on-site events.

crashAndBurn.title: Crash and Burn
crashAndBurn.description: Awarded to the team that embraces failure as a learning lesson for future success. (Only awarded to one team overall).

rookieOfTheYear.title: Rookie of the Year
rookieOfTheYear.description: Awarded to the top overall newcomer team. (Same judging criteria as overall award. If rookie team is awarded an overall award, the 2nd place standing rookie team will receive the award, and so forth. Only awarded to one team overall).

payItForward.title: Pay It Forward Award
payItForward.description: This Artemis Student Challenge (ASC) award is given to the team that best conducts impactful educational engagement events in their community or further. Educational engagement includes instructional, hands-on activities where participants engage in learning a STEM-related concept by actively participating in an activity.

innovation.title: Innovation Award
innovation.description: This Artemis Student Challenge (ASC) award is given to teams that best create new, innovative ideas and/or solutions within the scope of their respective challenge. Ingenuity, creativity, and inventiveness in either technology or non-technology focused ideas are awarded for their original ideas, creating efficiency, effective results, and/or solving a problem.

artemisEducator.title: Artemis Educator Award
artemisEducator.description: This Artemis Student Challenge (ASC) award is given to educators/faculty/mentors in each challenge as nominated by student team members. Student team members will recognize their faculty/mentor(s) who inspire learners and motivate them to work hard, achieving more than the team members thought possible.

otherAwards.title: Other Awards
otherAwards.description: Other awards will be given based on components of the competition, such as discussions within Design Review and Operational Readiness Review reports or the in-person competition.

mostImproved.title: Most Improved
mostImproved.description: Awarded to the team that demonstrates the greatest improvement between the two days of the competition.

2019.title: THE ORIGIN
2019.description: Our journey began in 2019 with a groundbreaking achievement: becoming the first university division team from our country to compete in the NASA Rover Challenge.

2020.title: PERSEVERANCE IN ADVERSITY
2020.description: Despite the challenges of the global pandemic, our resilience shone through. Lessons learned paved the way for our historic 'System Safety Award' victory.

2021.title: REVAMP AND REINVENTION
2021.description: With a revamped rover, our team reached new levels of expertise and ignited a passion for STEM in our community through innovative efforts.

2022.title: EXPANDING OUR IMPACT
2022.description: 2022 marked a turning point with the launch of our interactive 'STEM Tour,' culminating in winning the prestigious 'Engagement Award.'

2023.title: A HISTORIC YEAR
2023.description: A year of Dominican dominance! Major improvements earned us the 'Most Improved' and 'Team Spirit' awards, cementing our place in history.

2024.title: SETTING THE STANDARD
2024.description: Rising from 2023's successes, we reached new heights in 2024. Our hard work earned us the coveted 'Overall Award (2nd place)' and the 'Spirit Award,' showcasing excellence and unity.

2025.title: NEW FRONTIERS
2025.description: The dawn of the Apolo Division marks a new chapter in 2025. With our sights set high, we're pushing the boundaries of innovation and teamwork.
2025.rcDescription: Our RC team embarks on its first year with bold ideas and even bolder engineering. We're ready to make our mark in the world of remote-controlled exploration.

HERCSimulation.title: NASA HERC Simulation
HERCSimulation.caption: Exprience the NASA HERC with your own device.
HERCSimulation.description: On this Simulation, you will indulge into the competition team Apolo 27 will go through in Huntsville, Alabama. Learn the obstacles and tasks our Rover will face and help us get first in the shortest time possible! We trust you on this mission!

MathGame.title: Math Temple
MathGame.caption: Improve your math skills in the misterious Math Temple.
MathGame.description: Run, jump, and solve! Conquer the Math Temple with your arithmetic prowess. Math challenges await! Can you escape the temple with your math skills?

ScienceGame.title: Science Lab
ScienceGame.caption: Discover the elements that surround us.
ScienceGame.description: Unleash your inner scientist! Combine elements to discover the secrets of nature. Become a master of the elements.

TechnologyGame.title: Space Typing Hero
TechnologyGame.caption: Learn to use your keyboard like a pro.
TechnologyGame.description: Defend the galaxy with your typing skills! Type fast, shoot faster! Save the universe from alien invaders.

games.title: NASA HERC Simulation
games.caption: Experience the NASA HERC with your own device.

games.title: Big Alchemy
games.caption: Discover the elements that surround us.

games.title: Space Typing Hero
games.caption: Learn to use your keyboard like a pro.

games.title: Math Temple
games.caption: Improve your math skills in the mysterious Math Temple.

SocialMedia.subtitle: The social media team of Apolo 27 is in charge of managing our community and updating our country about all of our events and progress.

podcast.title: Podcast
podcast.name: Caribe STEM
podcast.description: Caribe STEM is a podcast created to share and disseminate STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) in the Dominican Republic and throughout Latin America. Created by Apolo 27, the university team representing INTEC in the NASA HERC competition.

youtube.description: Our videos showcase the engineering prowess and dedication that led us to become four-time category winners at HERC. Join us behind the scenes to see our innovative designs and the challenges we overcame.
youtube.continue: to stay updated on our latest projects and events.

video1.description: 🎥💸 When #Manufacturing needs $$$ and #Funding doesn't cooperate... 😂💀 💬 Who else can relate? 👇

video2.description: 🚀📚 The #Apolo27 team was present at the 2024 International Book Fair in the Dominican Republic! 🇩🇴✨ Beyond books, we took advantage of this incredible platform to share our mission, values, and everything we do as a team. 💡🔥 We connected with brilliant minds, explored new ideas, and showcased how #Apolo27 is making a difference. 🌟 Want to know more about our work? Leave your questions in the comments! 👇🤝 🎥✨ Hit play and discover how we experienced this special day! ❤️

connect.title: Connect with us!
connect.subtitle: FOLLOW US ON ALL OUR SOCIAL MEDIA

Sponsors.title: Sponsor Us
Sponsors.subtitle: Your support will help us get our country the recognition it deserves.
